}}'''James Nesbitt''' (born [[15 January]] [[1965]]) is a Northern Irish actor, best known for playing Adam Williams in the comedy-drama ''[[wikipedia:Cold Feet|Cold Feet]]'' and the starring role in the detective-drama ''[[wikipedia:Murphy's Law (TV series)|Murphy's Law]]''. He portrayed [[Bofur]] in [[The Hobbit (film series)|''The Hobbit'' (film series)]].<ref name="ComingSoon">[http://www.comingsoon.net/ ComingSoon.net], "[http://www.comingsoon.net/news/movienews.php?id=71316 James Nesbitt and Adam Brown Join ''The Hobbit'']" dated 1 November 2010 (accessed 9 July 2011)</ref>

His daughters are [[Mary Nesbitt|Mary]] and [[Peggy Nesbitt|Peggy]] Nesbitt, who play [[Bard]]'s daughters [[Tilda]] and [[Sigrid]] in ''[[The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug]]''.<ref>{{webcite|author=Evie Bowman |articleurl=http://middleearthnews.com/2013/09/24/james-nesbitts-girls-to-play-bards-daughters/|articlename=James Nesbitt’s Girls to Play Bard’s Daughters|dated=24 September 2013|website=[http://middleearthnews.com/ middleearthnews.com]|accessed=28 May 2014}}</ref>

==Filmography==
* [[2012]]  ''[[The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey]]'': [[Bofur]]
* [[2013]]  ''[[The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug]]'': Bofur
* [[2013]]  ''[[New Zealand: Home of Middle-earth]]'': Himself
* [[2014]]  ''[[Lego The Hobbit: The Video Game]]'': Bofur (archive footage)
* [[2014]]: ''[[The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies]]'': Bofur
